Effing rural religious families. I worked my butt off in school, got told every career dream I had was inappropriate for women, was convinced I shouldn't even apply to east coast schools because they were "too liberal." Picked a shit school in the middle of nowhere that gave me a full ride, just to escape somehow. They refused to help me get there, made me go to an Ivy-League priced (but not Ivy ranked) private school 20 minutes from home, and then when I got depressed and nearly flunked out and lost my scholarships told me I'd better stay at that little school even if I had to take out loans because I "clearly didn't have to confidence to handle a transfer." Judged me for dropping pre-med and going into the arts, even though I'd had a lifetime of "that[.] not appropriate for women" and "you'll be taking a job from a man who needs to support a family" and "nobody wants a woman who is smarter than they are" to the point where the only degree I felt no guilt about getting was a "useless" degree. Oh and then when I took out the loans to stay where I was convinced I had to stay, "nobody will marry you if you have student loan debt." Then after college when I had a complete fucking nervous breakdown they didn't understand why I didn't move away and "pursue my dreams," why I was stuck doing shit work in my hometown and living at home. I had no faith in myself left. It took me 15 years to get any back.

I got the fucking degrees, though, so fuck them. I'm massively in debt and probably always will be but I FINISHED. AND I'm married. And I can, in fact, work in my field. Will I ever not be angry? I doubt it. 
I am sharing this as a comment on your comment because I admire the way you handled your situation. I know you went through a lot but you did the_right thing. GOOD FOR YOU. I wish I had run away.
